page.title: 20PLUMBING, JOINERY & MASONRY
page.content: Mr.Cooper owns a{Do-It-Yourself shop in Burness. He stocks{calor gas}for cooking & heating;{timber; plumbing {equipment; concrete troughs;}etc. He works{6.5 days a week}&{10 hours a {day,}doing{plumbing, joinery & masonry for Sanday folk. His work is very {varied -}recently he has{unblocked Marygarth's{drains}&{slated}Mrs.Muir's roof. He is always busy{cleaning out {fires & sweeping chimneys.}Within the next year, he intends to{rebuild {Quivals' Garage.}Sometimes he is called away from his work (day or night) for{emergencies}like school {drains blocking, plumbing leaks}in houses or peoples'{fires failing.}His {wife,}Eileen, does all the{paperwork - {invoices, book-keeping & banking. {Wednesdays}are{especially busy}because he has to{collect}his{materials}from the boat.
